page.title: 04 Myths And Legends
page.content: During the rebuilding of Hinchingbrooke House in 1832 the skeletons of two nuns were found and are now on exhibition at Hinchingbrooke Upper School.There are several legends about this one of which is that when Henry 8th dissolved the monasteries two nuns escaped from the nunnery.They were persued to a bridge by soldiers and upon being surrounded jumped off the bridge.Legend has it that each night the nuns walk across the bridge.Two more legends about Hinchingbrooke House are (1)James 1st visited with his son Charles who met Cromwell in the garden and fought.(2)When Cromwell was young he visited his grandfather at the house and a monkey is alleged to have carried Cromwell across the rooftops.
